censuses</topcClas>         <topcClas>Teaching packages and test datasets - Reference and instructional resources</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social indicators and quality of life - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <I>Census 2011 Microdata Teaching File for England and Wales</I> is an SPSS/Stata edition of the Microdata Teaching File for England and Wales produced by the Office for National Statistics (ONS), drawn from data collected in the 2011 Census. The original Microdata Teaching File is an open government file which is available in spreadsheet format from the ONS Census 2011 <a href="http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/guide-method/census/2011/census-data/census-microdata/microdata-teaching-file/index.html" title="Microdata Teaching File">Microdata Teaching File</a> webpage. <br> <br> The file has been converted into SPSS and Stata by the Census Support service of the UK Data Service. The file was produced by ONS with a variables list and a user guide \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd all of which are considered the essential and definitive companions to the data. More information about the teaching file and Census 2011, including forms and links to other Census data, are available both on the ONS site (link above) or via the UK Data Service <a href="http://census.ukdataservice.ac.uk" title="Census Support">Census Support</a> webpages. <br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Age, economic activity, ethnicity, health, industry, marital status, occupation, region, religion, UK born.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="single" date="2011-03-27T00:00:00Z">27 March 2011</timePrd>         <nation>England and Wales</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Records from Census 2011, covering England and Wales.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Office for National Statistics</dataCollector>         <sampProc>One-stage stratified or systematic random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>569,741 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Postal survey</collMode>         <collMode>Web-based survey</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>This teaching dataset was compiled from the Microdata Teaching File, an open government file which is available in spreadsheet format from the ONS Census 2011 <a href="http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/guide-method/census/2011/census-data/census-microdata/microdata-teaching-file/index.html" title="Microdata Teaching File">Microdata Teaching File</a> webpage.</dataSrc>         </sources>         <weight>No weighting used.</weight>         <cleanOps>A*</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Open</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is not required.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>         <conditions>These data are available to any user for any purpose under the <a href="http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/" title="Open Government Licence">Open Government Licence</a></conditions>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
